result.execSummary:
The defendant Keyla M Rosa Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Rosa Perez, Keyla M
defendant.address: 2370 South 107th Street Apt 1, West Allis, WI 53227

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3/10/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Keyla M Rosa Perez in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.  FINAL DPA REVIEW held.  Defendant has completed classes and counseling programs.
On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Co. Ord. 63.01 to which defendant pled guilty.
Court found defendant guilty and SUSPENDS SENTENCE.  Court waives all costs and orders that money on deposit be returned.
Branch 38 will not be in session on 1-15-2016.  Clerk contacted State and Defense to advise that matter will be adjourned to 1-22-2016 for review.
Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez.  mld

Defendant Keyla M Rosa Perez in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Daniel Lopez.
Mid Point Review hearing proceeded. Defendant is currently in compliance with the terms of the deferred prosecution agreement.  Case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 38 on 1-15-2016 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

COURT ORDERS contact with the children as ordered by Family Court; no violent contact with children; exchange of children must by through a third party; no in-person contact with the father, but contact with him may be by telephone.

Defendant Keyla M Rosa Perez in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 04.  Ruth Garcia, intepreter, sworn-in.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed. Court approves the agreement. 

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint and STAYS a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.  Review hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to Br. 4 in trial, case transferred to Br. 44 for Review Hearing.   mld

The Court ordered that the defendant may communicate with the children in written form only.  Correspondence may be sent to the household, addressed to the children, and defendant is not allowed to discuss the case or the divorce.   mld

Defendant Keyla M Rosa Perez in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter was waived by defense counsel for the purposes of these proceedings only.  Parties are exploring a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  
Defense Motion to Modify the No Contact Order as to the children (ONLY) is heard and granted by the Court.  The Court ordered that the defendant may communicate with the children in written form only.  Correspondence may be sent to the household, addressed to the children, and defendant is not allowed to discuss the case or the divorce.  The State is opposed to the modification of the no contact order at this date.  Case adjourned for continued discussions regarding broader contact after discussions are held regarding a potential deferred prosecution agreement.  Case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-15-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Keyla M Rosa Perez in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense waived Spanish Interpreter for the purposes ot today's proceedings.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-19-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.  All conditions of bail are continued, including the no contact order and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
$175.00 bail to be returned.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Keyla M Rosa Perez
Current: 2370 South 107th Street Apt 1, West Allis, WI 53227   (Effective: 01-29-2015)
Prior: 2370 South 107th Street Apt 1, West Allis, WI 53227
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Noel D., K.M.,K.D.V(dob 10/12/08) and KDV(dob 12/20/03)

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Br.04.vb

Defendant Keyla M Rosa Perez in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter: Vicki Bermudez

01-17-2015
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/29/15 @ 1:30pm
